intro: Fimbristylis unispicularis, commonly known as the single-bristled sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale green to brown flowers. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense vegetation in suitable environments. Fimbristylis unispicularis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in wetlands and along water edges.
